metadata.title: USN-6764-1 -- libde265 vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that libde265 could be made to allocate memory that exceeds the maximum supported size. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6764-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libde265-0 - 1.0.2-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm5 libde265-dev - 1.0.2-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm5 libde265-examples - 1.0.2-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm5 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
